metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11703 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw in Thunderbird's implementation of iCal causes a heap buffer overflow in parser_get_next_char when processing certain email messages, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 60.7.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11703` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.1+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
